subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.
author: Fransen, Debbie
full_text:
------_=_NextPart_001_01C9E057.3BD6E090
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Of course Chris Moon speaks highly of him.
Frank has made him lots of money=
.

________________________________

From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:=
EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of Elaine Coates
Sent: Thursday, May 28,=
 2009 3:49 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different =
chip config.





Okay, then could I have a copy of the new schematic when =
you get it
drawn?  That would be even better.  Where are you from?  Chris M=
oon
speaks highly of you.


________________________________

From: Frank S=
umption <purplealiengirl@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thurs=
day, May 28, 2009 2:29:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.
=



Besides--I didn't like that radio design, it's too complex, and the
docu=
mentation is screwy. I did a simpler radio last night that should be
better=
, simpler, cheaper, and clearer sound. 


On Thu, May 28, 2009 at 5:41 AM, =
Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com
<mailto:cozykat2003@...> > wrot=
e:




	
	The jpg for this schematic is kind of blurry in places.  Is
there=
 any way a more clear copy could be send to me? I would be forever
grateful=
.  Thanks Frank - Elaine
	

	
________________________________

	From: Fran=
k Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com
<mailto:purplealiengirl@...> >=

	
	To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com <mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
	Sent: T=
hursday, May 28, 2009 12:55:00 AM
	Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip co=
nfig.
	
	

	
	http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/
<http://purplealiengirl.=
tripod.com/>  
	 
	 However, it's constantly changing. The radio I made ton=
ight is
very simple, and can significantly simplify construction. I used to=
 make
the sweep and amplifier circuits, then use a commercial radio, like t=
he
12-469, as a tuner. 
	 
	 The MK484 is follwed by a couple high impedenc=
e op amp stages
to bring the audio up to line levels. I haven't had time to=
 do schematic
yet. I draw the schematics with MS paint, and they are stored=
 as jpeg
images, which isn't the best, but it makes them e-mailable. 
	 
	 =
Frank-S
	
	
	On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:54 PM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@
y=
ahoo.com <mailto:cozykat2003@...> > wrote:
	



		
		Hi folks, I just=
 joined this group.  I was recently at
the Lizzy Borden house in Massachuse=
tts with Chris Moon and had a
session with Frank's Box.  The results were a=
stounding.  Is this the
newest schematic for Frank's box?  If so, is there =
a way to get a
clearer copy of it?  My son said he would build one for me a=
nd I have
been searching for the schematic.  Can anyone help? - Elaine
		

=
		
________________________________

		From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengir=
l@ gmail.com
<mailto:purplealiengirl@...> >
		
		To: evp-itc@yahoogro=
ups .com
<mailto:evp-itc@yahoogroups.com> ; grassharp@yahoogrou ps.com
<mai=
lto:grassharp@yahoogroups.com>  

		Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 5:45:16 P=
M
		Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config. [1 Attachment]
		


		
		 I t=
hink I followed an erroneous LM3820 layout, so I'm
going to breadboard this=
 layout. Note the antenna input is now on pin
12-11, this is the RF amp inp=
ut, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, which
feeds pin 1.
		 
		 'case anyone=
 cares. 
		 
		 F-S
